title: Understanding SQL WHERE Clause
text: The WHERE clause in SQL is used to filter records based on specific conditions. It is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified condition.

title: Using DATE Function in SQL
text: The DATE() function in SQL is used to extract the date part from a date or datetime expression. It is useful when you want to compare only the date part of a datetime value.

title: Combining Conditions with AND
text: In SQL, the AND operator is used to combine multiple conditions in a WHERE clause. All conditions must be true for the record to be selected.

title: Formulating the SQL Query
text: To select records with a Day entry before January $$10$$, $$2016$$, and an Amount value more than $1000, you need to use the WHERE clause with the DATE function and the AND operator.
